website_summaries.verdict: If you need a receiver with ample channels without spending a lot of money, this model is worth a look despite a few known issues.
pros: A 9-channel receiver for a reasonable price
Easy to set up right out of the box
Has ample inputs for customizable home entertainment possibilities
cons: Occasional HDMI pass through issues reported

customer_reviews.title: Great amp
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality, easy to set up, so far everything works great. If I had to improve something it would be the apps. There are 2 apps to download to go with the unit (why not just one?). One as a controller/remote the other to stream music; both apps are not self explanatory and in many functions redundant. Just one should be created that does everything and is easy to use. Beside that I would highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Matteo G

customer_reviews.title: Had to get it fixed already
customer_reviews.text: Just bought an Onkyo TX-RZ730 and after about 2 months of using it the Main and Sub HDMI out no longer works. I called Onkyo and they took me through some troubleshooting which I completed all as requested but it still didn't work. They said that it must be the HDMI board on the device and they said I need to send it to an authorized repair company but they aren't paying for the shipping. So as it turns out if you decide to buy this product you will most likely have to add another $30 or so to the price and you will go without it for a month or so until it's repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Pokorney

customer_reviews.title: Issues with 4K HDR Content
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was excellent. I ran into issues with this receiver passing 4K HDR 4:4:4 content even though the spec says it can. It would completely drop the signal for 20-30 seconds every hour or so. I changed out hdmi cables and still had the same issue. I bypassed the unit altogether for nearly a week and had no issues before sending it back. The receiver I replaced it now has no issues. Sound was great and 1080p content was fine, but if you want to do 4K HDR go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: The screen continues to go black randomly.
customer_reviews.text: The black screen has gotten worse. I will need to get a different receiver. This is not working on the second try. It worked for a few months but has gone from 1 blink a month , to multiple blinks per show. UPDATE 2/2020: Using a different HDMI port seems better. Still have random blur when the input is recently changed. Spotify is almost useless, but most my music is played else where.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade over previous system
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace an Onkyo TX-RZ710. I like Dolby Atmos and this receiver allows me to use all of the 7.1.2 components I have (the RZ710 could only do either 7.1 or 5.1.2. The audio return channel allows me to allows me to connect an older, low-res game system to my TV but still get surround audio from my receiver. I might have taken a risk buying this receiver after the right side audio channel failed on the RZ710 but I'm satisfied, so far.
customer_reviews.author: carterjm

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 days
customer_reviews.text: So I actually really enjoyed this product. Until it just stopped working! I used it one night and the next day it stopped working for no reason. I was using this system for Atmos as a 5.1.4 setup. I am being sent a new one so hopefully the new one does break. I will say I had a Panasonic receiver for 20 years never once an issue this one 2 weeks and bam stopped working. Called Onkyo they said I need to take it to a service center.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Fisch

customer_reviews.title: Do it yourself
customer_reviews.text: I am setting up my on system that Best Buy said they can’t do. The Geek Squad. My awesome Onkyo, AV Receiver TX-RZ730, Klipsch 5.2 speakers, and a gorgeous vent free fireplace. Just watch UTube and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Atchley

customer_reviews.title: Produces great sound.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Been looking for THX and this is absolutely wonderful. Sounds like theater quality. Great price too.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great WiFi app control
customer_reviews.text: great sound and lots of channels but the WiFi function is not super consistent. Music stops playing now and again and I sometimes can’t connect to the receiver using the app. My Yamaha was more consistent but it had other issues too. Was hoping the WiFi controls was better than Yamaha but dont think so at this point.
customer_reviews.author: austin

customer_reviews.title: Works very well with HDMI connections
customer_reviews.text: This receiver works great and it was a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Hornitos20

customer_reviews.title: Is this thing on?
customer_reviews.text: Well, let’s just say I’m having a beast of a time connecting my devices and my sound bar and the surround speakers with the tv. Everything seems to work in pieces, but not all at once. I tackle this project every other day but don’t make much headway.
customer_reviews.author: S. Lowery

customer_reviews.title: Great! But comeon give us the darn EARC update as 830 got!
customer_reviews.text: Great only complaint is the intentional leaving off upgrade for earc, it cost just as much as the 830 (2 months later dammit) but they refuse to add this. no reason other than to make you upgrade. With that out of the way, everything about it is great best sound i have heard from anything at home. options are great, havent even really dug into it yet.
customer_reviews.author: daniel case

customer_reviews.title: Solid design and packed with the latest features
customer_reviews.text: This thing is packed with everything I need and more. The most important thing it comes with is rca outputs to add an external amplifier for my front tower speakers.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Head

customer_reviews.title: onkyo customer service is great
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound quality of the receiver. It is my main sound system very good product. I owned an Onkyo receiver back in the 70s, liked it then and now.
customer_reviews.author: al p

customer_reviews.title: Great receiver at an excellent price
customer_reviews.text: Great sound and excellent value. Hooked up to a 75R617 and passes Dolby Vision and HDR without any issues. Atmos and DTS:X give an immersive experience.
customer_reviews.author: robert harris

customer_reviews.title: Run!!!  Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Horrible! This is my second one and having issues again. Onkyo rep says they are aware of issues but "oh well". They may work on it.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: This receiver was easy to set up and the price didn’t break the bank.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Good power and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I did 2 months of research and decided on this one. I have it set up for a 5.2.4 Dolby Atmos system and it works great
customer_reviews.author: John Feeney

customer_reviews.title: Dead HDMI board after 7 months
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be the model with "higher quality components" and yet here we are with a paper weight only 7 months in. RIP OFF.
customer_reviews.author: J. Seemueller

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and Picture.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent rich sound with great 4k upcaling. I've a Samsung qled 7 and when I connected this receiver the pictures from my direct tv got even more better. I've this powering two center micca speaker, 2 surround and 2 surround back speakers all of which are also Micca 8 series
customer_reviews.author: Mcbrains

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Had a onkyo tx sr 607 and it sounded great. This one sounds even better. I couldn't be happier so far.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 6 months and now won’t stay on.
customer_reviews.author: JoeAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Great Receiver, Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Piece of cake to set up and auto-calibrate. Picture and sound are GREAT. Automatically feeds-through the source of your choice. Auto on/off, if other components support it. Lots of cool features. One downer...I wish I could AirPlay music while watching TV (HDMI input), but it is not possible to select an alternate audio source. UPDATE: I figured out how to Airplay and watch video from separate sources! Changed to 5*. Receiver HDMI Zone 2 out -> TV HDMI 2 Turn off receiver's CEC. Set Zone 2 source to "CABLE/SAT". Set TV to HDMI 2, and turn volume to 0. AirPlay to receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Brown

customer_reviews.title: Underwhelmed across the board
customer_reviews.text: I'm underwhelmed by this model. The sound is clean, but not extraordinary, and the features are not anything special. There just doesn't seem to be much power or depth to the sound. Compared to my old school rotel and adcom amps, it's really flat (I know, different leagues, but they give a good point of reference). It lacks all video services, and the chromecast is only for audio. The remote lacks any kind of controls for other devices. I really expected something better than average from a mid range model from Onkyo.
customer_reviews.author: Galka

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy Onkyo
customer_reviews.text: I have had three receivers since college, I am 61 now. The first one a Yamaha very good. The second one a Denon good but missing some power. Decided to buy an Onkyo looking for power. Got a little more power. But, Three years into the purchase I started having problems, the receiver just faded away, it doesn't work anymore. I have tried everything, not working. Lost all sound, maybe a chip problem but Onkyo doesn't respond. I am doomed. Just don't do it. Buy Yamaha or Denon. Onkyo is trash. Going back to Yamaha.
customer_reviews.author: LIONEL ROGER

product_meta.title: Onkyo TX-RZ730 9.2 Channel 4k Network A/V Receiver Black
product_meta.description: Here's a budget-friendly a/V receiver with the core power needed for 7. 2. 4-Ch (with external amp) Dolby Atmos or DTS: x playback at THX Certified select theater-reference volume to enhance the jaw-dropping spectacle of 4K HDR video as it unfolds on screen. Dynamic audio amplification blends high current with patented noise-reduction technology to achieve fluent transients, superb detail resolution, and wide 5 hz-100 kHz frequency response. Music from any source is emotionally involving, from Hi-Res audio to LP Records to multi-room network music via chrome cast built-in, flare Connect, and DTS Play-Fi technology. With 11. 2-Multichannel pre-outs, powered zone 2 and powered zone 3 speaker outputs, it's easy to configure a reliable home-theater layout and audio distribution setup that suits you. The TX-RZ730 streamlines entertainment with future-ready HDMI handling Dolby Vision, HLG, and HDR10 formats. Premium AccuEQ advance room-acoustic calibration with multi-point measurement ensures balanced sound. Just relax and soak up the magic only an Onkyo can deliver.
feature_bullets: Thx-certified select theater Reference power 100 W/Ch. (8 ohms, 20 Hz-20 kHz, 0. 08% THD, 2 Ch. Driven, FTC) and 225 W/Ch. (6 ohms, 1 kHz, 10% THD, 1 Ch. Driven)
Dolby Atmos and DTS: x playback through 5. 2. 4 or 7. 2. 2 channels and now with 11. 2 multichannel pre-outs and processing for 7. 2. 4-Ch playback with an external stereo power amp

Your Onkyo receiver can now be part of your existing Sonos home sound system, or the start of a new one. Instantly upgrade the music streaming capability of your home theater receiver with Sonos connect and a free firmware update.
Hdmi 7 in (rear), main out, and Sub/zone 2 out supporting 4K/60 Hz, HDR10, hlg, Dolby vision, BT. 2020, and HDCP 2. 2 pass-through/ 1 front HDMI for convenience
Powered zone 2 and powered zone 3 speaker outputs, zone 2 and new zone 3 line-level outputs with DACs supporting digital and analog Audio playback
Rz build quality: dynamic Audio amplification with 5 hz-100 kHz frequency response, high current power supply and extra-large customized block capacitors for instant power
